title: These days kids are so fond of gadgets. How do we try to make them realise that gadgets aren't the only source to have fun? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unfortunately the definition of "fun" evolves with each generation as the "toys" advance. I suspect your definition of fun might be based on what you did for entertainment as a child. Those standards no longer apply in today's world. Two hundred years ago a child's idea of fun might have been riding a horse, catching frogs at the local swimming hole, or finding the time to read a  real book. those days for the most part are gone. Today its video games, television, etc. Two hundred years from now people will probably look back and consider it "quaint"  at what today's kids consider fun.

One day they will find out themselves, just because older generations did not have gadgets to have fun with while growing op does not mean that gadgets are a bad source to have fun. Most likely there will come one day that they are fed up with their gadgets and will make fun by use of other sources then just gadgets.
